full_text: This demonstration is a continuation of the previous trouble ticket demonstration. Ashley, the policy holder, has requested removal of the late fee that she was charged. Jeff Park decides to add an activity to the trouble ticket to accomplish this task. Let's add an activity to the trouble ticket to assign the responsibility for removing the late fee. I clicked the link in the trouble ticket alert. I can create the activity on the activities tab of the trouble ticket we created in the previous demo. I want to be able to assign this activity to a billing center user, so I click the arrow icon for new assigned activity. I select to do from the request menu. An activity often serves as a request to do something. I click in the subject field. And type in remove late fee. For the description, I'll type in the policy number. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I I click in the Assign to field. And assign the activity to myself. I click Update to save the new activity. The new activity is listed at the bottom of the trouble ticket screen. Now I'll go to my desktop to view the activity. Here it is in the list of activities that are assigned to me. I'll click the subject, Remove Late Fee. Because the activity is associated with a trouble ticket, Billing Center opens the trouble ticket screen. I can see the activity listed in the workspace below. The activity directs me to remove the late fee. To do this, I return to the policy summary. Here's the late fee in the Financials section. I click the arrow icon for the Late Fee field. And select Reverse. There's only one late fee listed. I click Select. Step 2 allows me to select a reason. I select Customer Request. To complete the removal of the late fee, I click Finish. I see immediately that the late fee has been cleared. Next, I can revisit the trouble ticket and mark the activity complete. I click Complete Activity. Now let's assume that Billing Center has received the policy change billing request that lowers Ashley's bill. This means that I can close the trouble ticket. On the trouble ticket screen, I click Close. Closing the trouble ticket automatically closes all trouble ticket holds and open activities associated with the trouble ticket. I click OK. Let's see what has happened with the delinquency. I clicked the link in the alert bar. The status of the delinquency is now open. This is because closing the trouble ticket released the hold on delinquency processing. Let's look at the delinquency events. The target date for Dunning Letter 2 is no longer displayed in red. The date has been adjusted to allow time for Ashley to receive the adjusted invoice and to pay it. This concludes our demonstration on trouble tickets and activities.

segments.text: This demonstration is a continuation of the previous trouble ticket demonstration. Ashley, the policy holder, has requested removal of the late fee that she was charged. Jeff Park decides to add an activity to the trouble ticket to accomplish this task. Let's add an activity to the trouble ticket to assign the responsibility for removing the late fee. I clicked the link in the trouble ticket alert. I can create the activity on the activities tab of the trouble ticket we created in the previous demo. I want to be able to assign this activity to a

billing center user, so I click the arrow icon for new assigned activity. I select to do from the request menu. An activity often serves as a request to do something. I click in the subject field. And type in remove late fee. For the description, I'll type in the policy number.

I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click the winner. I click in the Assign to field.
And assign the activity to myself.
I click Update to save the new activity.
The new activity is listed at the bottom of the trouble ticket screen.
Now I'll go to my desktop to view the activity.
Here it is in the list of activities that are assigned to me.
I'll click the subject, Remove Late Fee.
Because the activity is associated with a trouble ticket, Billing Center opens the trouble ticket screen.
I can see the activity listed in the workspace below.
The activity directs me to remove the late fee.
To do this, I return to the policy summary.
Here's the late fee in the Financials section.
I click the arrow icon for the Late Fee field.
And select Reverse.
There's only one late fee listed.
I click Select.
Step 2 allows me to select a reason.
I select Customer Request.
To complete the removal of the late fee, I click Finish.
I see immediately that the late fee has been cleared.
Next, I can revisit the trouble ticket and mark the activity complete.
I click Complete Activity.
Now let's assume that Billing Center has received the policy change billing request that lowers Ashley's bill.
This means that I can close the trouble ticket.
On the trouble ticket screen, I click Close.
Closing the trouble ticket automatically closes all trouble ticket holds and open activities associated with the trouble ticket.
I click OK.
Let's see what has happened with the delinquency.
I clicked the link in the alert bar.
The status of the delinquency is now open.
This is because closing the trouble ticket released the hold on delinquency processing.
Let's look at the delinquency events.
The target date for Dunning Letter 2 is no longer displayed in red.
The date has been adjusted to allow time for Ashley to receive the adjusted invoice and to pay it.
This concludes our demonstration on trouble tickets and activities.
